metadata.title: CVE-2022-1116 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - high
metadata.description:
Integer Overflow or Wraparound vulnerability in io_uring of Linux Kernelallows local attacker to cause memory corruption and escalate privileges toroot. This issue affects: Linux Kernel versions prior to 5.4.189; version5.4.24 and later versions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1116` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 5.15.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 5.15.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 5.15.0-1002.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 5.15.0-1005.5
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-aws package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1004.6').
linux-azure package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1003.4').
linux-gcp package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1003.6').
linux-ibm package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1002.2').
linux-lowlatency package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-24.24').
linux-oracle package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1002.4').
linux-raspi package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1005.5').
